messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> 2. Is there a good way to test SWT?
>
>
> Yes, Eclipse is automatically tested this way. A couple of Eclipse books
> cover this and you can find more information on http://eclipse.org (I
> realize you asked for SWT testing, but testing Eclipse is even more
> complex,
> so testing SWT should be easier).

Yes, and no. Eclipse has great support for running integration tests
that drive the UI on top of the OSGi plug-in model. These tests are too
slow to effectively participate in minute-to-minute TDD, in my
experience. (Contrary to the practice espoused in Contributing to
Eclipse, otherwise a really great book.) Unfortunately, SWT is built in
a way that prevents you from creating any user-interface element without
at least opening a window to display it in.

> Google so far says 'not really'. I've made some painful conclusions and
> > > design decisions from this. Chief among them has been, "if you need to
> > > test the UI, you've probably got model code in your view classes. Fix
> > > that first."

That's the same place I'm living. I trust my integration tests to catch
glaring UI problems, and user testing beyond that.

Good luck,

David Saff
